snippet: King Abdullah issued a royal decree that punishes citizens who fight in conflicts outside the kingdom, with prison sentences ranging from three years to 20.
abstract: King Abdullah of Saudi Arabia issues a royal decree that punishes citizens who fight in conflicts outside the kingdom; statement also says that any Saudi citizen who joins or aids terrorist groups will face five years to 30 years in jail; decree appears to be aimed at stemming the flow of Saudi fighters going to Syria.
lead_paragraph: King Abdullah issued a royal decree that punishes citizens who fight in conflicts outside the kingdom, with prison sentences ranging from three years to 20.

headline.main: Saudi Arabia: Decree Lays Out Penalties for Fighting Abroad
